item.title: YouTube-DL
item.description:
Watch Content Offline

For the past few weeks, I am off from YouTube. My YouTube channel is getting mirrored on Odysee. But I still follow my favorite content creators using Invidious, Odysee, and youtube-dl.

As most of you would know, what happened with the repository of youtube-dl I am glad that it’s back and functional again. Setting up youtube-dl for the first time can be troublesome for new users, but once you get the hang of it, you would not stop, especially with config, the download process becomes easy.

Here is my config, and yes, I am on a Windows machine for now.

-f mp4
-f 137+140/299+140
-o C:/Users/Joel/Downloads/YouTube/%(title)s-%(uploader)s.%(ext)s
--no-mtime

Refer Output Template for more details

For those who wanted to get started with youtube-dl, here is a great video to begin.

My process of getting videos offline is simple. Get the link of the video from invidious and paste it into the command prompt. But if I am on my phone, I use Newpipe to watch and download YouTube videos.

item.title: Create More, Consume Less
item.description:
People overestimate the benefits of learning by consuming things.

Writing and learning are two seperate things but both are very powerful tools with which can help you to build your audience and opens up a new world of opportunities to you to discover.

Most of the time we consume more and think that we are learning which is hoax. Whenever we stumble upon anything which we want to learn the first step is the absorb the material and then make notes about it. Think like you will be giving a lecture about the topic which you learnt. Making notes of your own will help you to deepen the understanding of the topic, a great example of this is feynman technique.

Performing daily writing of what you learnt will create a reservoir of knowledge which you can then use for your success like sharing your learning with people online. This will also help you to improve your learning process because you will be getting feedback from the other people.
